title: Padé approximants of special functions
abstract: Let $ {f_{\gamma }}(x) = \sum\nolimits_{{k = 0}}^{\infty } {{{{T_k (x)}} \left/ {{{{\left( \gamma \right)}_k}}} \right.}} $ , where (γ) k =γ(γ+1) ⋯ (γ+k−1) and T k (x)=cos (k arccos x) are Pade–Chebyshev polynomials. For such functions and their Pade–Chebyshev approximations $ \pi_{n,m}^{ch}\left( {x;{f_{\gamma }}} \right) $ , we find the asymptotics of decreasing the difference $ {f_{\gamma }}(x) - \pi_{n,m}^{ch}\left( {x;{f_{\gamma }}} \right) $ in the case where 0 ⩽ m ⩽ m(n), m(n) = o (n), as n→∞ for all x ∈ [−1, 1]. Particularly, we determine that, under the same assumption, the Pade–Chebyshev approximations converge to f γ uniformly on the segment [−1, 1] with the asymptotically best rate.

motivations: There is a need to understand the asymptotics of the difference between special functions and their Padé-Chebyshev approximations.
The convergence rate of Padé-Chebyshev approximations to special functions is not well understood.
objectives: Find the asymptotics of the difference between special functions fγ(x) and their Padé-Chebyshev approximations πn,mch(x;fγ) as n→∞.
Determine the convergence rate of Padé-Chebyshev approximations to special functions fγ(x) uniformly on the segment [−1, 1].
methods: Use Padé-Chebyshev polynomials T k (x)=cos (k arccos x) to approximate special functions fγ(x).
Analyze the asymptotics of the difference between fγ(x) and πn,mch(x;fγ) as n→∞ for all x ∈ [−1, 1].
results: The Padé-Chebyshev approximations converge to special functions fγ(x) uniformly on the segment [−1, 1] with the asymptotically best rate.
The asymptotics of the difference between fγ(x) and πn,mch(x;fγ) are determined for the case where 0 ⩽ m ⩽ m(n), m(n) = o (n), as n→∞.
